properties.name: Acropolis Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Sreisz1647 Richland Ave WWe were headed back towards Georgia (we knew whe had to start wandering back towards home), and stopped near the GA / SC border. We found a little hole in the wall place called Acropolis Pizza. Kinda scary looking on the outside, but wonderful food and people on the inside. Pizza and Greek/Italian food. We went in expecting to order pizza, ended up getting things like dolmas and spanikopita instead. Everything was great. And it was the kind of place where a regular would shout into the kitchen, "Hey Mary, I\'m actually ordering something off the menu for once!" We met the owners, Mary and (I think) George. A nice married couple who go back to the old country every year or so. If you\'re ever in the area, you really should check it out.

properties.name: Augusta GA
properties.description: Posted by SreiszOur last stop. We stumbled on an "Art in the Park" kind of festival, walked around, ate roasted corn on the cob, and watched the river for a while. When we were ready to leave, we realized we kinda needed to get back home. So we declared our honeymoon over, hopped on the interstate and headed back to Alabama.

properties.name: Charleston
properties.description: Posted by SreiszWe had thought about heading towards Georgia from Charlotte, but we saw how close we were to the coast and decided to head for Charleston instead. If Charlotte was our one and only bust, Charleston was the unexpected surprise of the trip. No end to the great food, great people, historic houses, nice walks and neat shops. This is just a place holder until I can spend more time browsing the map and finding all the neat things we did there. We have gone back to Charleston once since our honeymoon, and are planning another trip in the near future.

properties.name: Charlotte
properties.description: Posted by SreiszNo offense to the folks in Charlotte, but for us, it was our one and only bust. I have no doubt that a place as big as Charlotte has plenty for the wandering tourist to see and do, but we somehow missed it all. We ended up staying at a rather scary motel and eating rather bad pizza.

properties.name: Fall Creek Falls
properties.description: Posted by Sreisz   We had thought we might want to do some camping while driving around, and we were right. We realized we were within driving distance of one of the prettiest places in the Southeast. Full of hiking trails, waterfalls, overlooks and the like. And since the tent we brought was a 6\'x9\' canvas wedge, we got some odd looks from the other campers, but we also weren\'t baked out of our tent at 6 in the morning

properties.name: Historic Jonesborough
properties.description: Posted by SreiszWe were headed to Johnson City, and realized we were going to go straight through the oldest permanent settlement in Tennessee. So we absolutely had to stop. We walked around all the old houses, each with a rich history of early American life. Be sure to check out the place where Andrew Jackson was almost tarred and feathered.

properties.name: Johnson City
properties.description: Posted by SreiszJohnson CityA couple great things here. One is the "Museum of Ancient Brick" Actually it\'s an "Exhibit of Ancient Brick" in the office lobby of a brick company. But it\'s still pretty neat. There\'s even some ancient Egyptian (I think) brick with some grafitti from someone in the Roman Legion. Also, a great restaurant called Cafe Pacific. When we showed up, we realized that we were terribly underdressed, and that this was the kind of place that expects reservations. But we explained that we were passing through and didn\'t know they existed before today. They were terribly nice, and the food was fantastic. More on both when I have time to find them individually on the map

properties.name: Knoxville
properties.description: Posted by SreiszNot much to report here. I don\'t even think we stayed the night. We did drive and walk around downtown and see the sights

properties.name: Tennessee Aquarium
properties.description: Posted by SreiszTennessee AquariumThe Tennessee Aquarium, a huge aquarium with salt water and fresh water exhibits. They had a really cool seahorse exhibit, and a hands on (!) sturgeon exhibit.

properties.name: Where we got married
properties.description: Posted by SreiszAnnunciation of the Lord Catholic Church August 9, 2003 We were actually the first couple to be married at the church.
